description: Returns the history of the specified execution as a list of events. By default, the results are returned in ascending order of the timeStamp of the events. Use the reverseOrder parameter to get the latest events first. If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Each pagination token expires after 24 hours. Using an expired pagination token will return an HTTP 400 InvalidToken error. This API action is not supported by EXPRESS state machines.

parameters.name: executionArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the execution.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of results that are returned per call. You can use nextToken to obtain further pages of results. The default is 100 and the maximum allowed page size is 1000. A value of 0 uses the default. This is only an upper limit. The actual number of results returned per call might be fewer than the specified maximum.

nested_items.name: events
nested_items.description: The list of events that occurred in the execution.

nested_items.name: timestamp
nested_items.description: The date and time the event occurred.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of the event.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The id of the event. Events are numbered sequentially, starting at one.

nested_items.name: previousEventId
nested_items.description: The id of the previous event.

nested_items.name: activityFailedEventDetails
nested_items.description: Contains details about an activity that failed during an execution.

nested_items.name: error
nested_items.description: The error code of the failure.

nested_items.name: cause
nested_items.description: A more detailed explanation of the cause of the failure.

nested_items.name: activityScheduleFailedEventDetails
nested_items.description: Contains details about an activity schedule event that failed during an execution.

nested_items.name: error
nested_items.description: The error code of the failure.

nested_items.name: cause
nested_items.description: A more detailed explanation of the cause of the failure.

nested_items.name: activityScheduledEventDetails
nested_items.description: Contains details about an activity scheduled during an execution.

nested_items.name: resource
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the scheduled activity.

nested_items.name: input
nested_items.description: The JSON data input to the activity task. Length constraints apply to the payload size, and are expressed as bytes in UTF-8 encoding.

nested_items.name: inputDetails
nested_items.description: Contains details about the input for an execution history event.

nested_items.name: truncated
nested_items.description: Indicates whether input or output was truncated in the response. Always false for API calls. In CloudWatch logs, the value will be true if the data is truncated due to size limits.

nested_items.name: timeoutInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum allowed duration of the activity task.

nested_items.name: heartbeatInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum allowed duration between two heartbeats for the activity task.

nested_items.name: activityStartedEventDetails
nested_items.description: Contains details about the start of an activity during an execution.

nested_items.name: workerName
nested_items.description: The name of the worker that the task is assigned to. These names are provided by the workers when calling  GetActivityTask.

nested_items.name: activitySucceededEventDetails
nested_items.description: Contains details about an activity that successfully terminated during an execution.

nested_items.name: output
nested_items.description: The JSON data output by the activity task. Length constraints apply to the payload size, and are expressed as bytes in UTF-8 encoding.

nested_items.name: outputDetails
nested_items.description: Contains details about the output of an execution history event.

nested_items.name: truncated
nested_items.description: Indicates whether input or output was truncated in the response. Always false for API calls. In CloudWatch logs, the value will be true if the data is truncated due to size limits.

nested_items.name: activityTimedOutEventDetails
nested_items.description: Contains details about an activity timeout that occurred during an execution.

nested_items.name: error

nested_items.name: cause
nested_items.description: A more detailed explanation of the cause of the timeout.

nested_items.description: The number of times you've redriven an execution. If you have not yet redriven an execution, the redriveCount is 0. This count is not updated for redrives that failed to start or are pending to be redriven.

nested_items.description: Indicates whether assigned variables were truncated in the response. Always false for API calls. In CloudWatch logs, the value will be true if the data is truncated due to size limits.

nested_items.name: mapRunStartedEventDetails
nested_items.description: Contains details, such as mapRunArn, and the start date and time of a Map Run. mapRunArn is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Map Run that was started.

nested_items.name: mapRunArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a Map Run that was started.

nested_items.name: mapRunFailedEventDetails
nested_items.description: Contains error and cause details about a Map Run that failed.

nested_items.name: error
nested_items.description: The error code of the Map Run failure.

nested_items.name: cause
nested_items.description: A more detailed explanation of the cause of the failure.

nested_items.name: mapRunRedrivenEventDetails
nested_items.description: Contains details about the redrive attempt of a Map Run.

nested_items.name: mapRunArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a Map Run that was redriven.

nested_items.name: redriveCount
nested_items.description: The number of times the Map Run has been redriven at this point in the execution's history including this event. The redrive count for a redriven Map Run is always greater than 0.

nested_items.name: evaluationFailedEventDetails
nested_items.description: Contains details about an evaluation failure that occurred while processing a state.

nested_items.name: error
nested_items.description: The error code of the failure.

nested_items.name: cause
nested_items.description: A more detailed explanation of the cause of the failure.

nested_items.name: location
nested_items.description: The location of the field in the state in which the evaluation error occurred.

nested_items.name: state
nested_items.description: The name of the state in which the evaluation error occurred.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Each pagination token expires after 24 hours. Using an expired pagination token will return an HTTP 400 InvalidToken error.
